text:
A Quiet Escape

A dimly lit canal bank, few people around.  
His heart races, sweat drips.  
Stranger: “My word, he has been going it!”  

---

Inside the staircase, he feels faint.  
Thoughts swirl, but clarity evades him.  
He remembers the axe—panic sets in!  

---

The porter’s door is closed.  
He opens it, heart pounding.  
“Please, not now!” he whispers.  

---

In his room, he collapses on the sofa.  
No sleep, just a void of thought.  
“Did I really escape?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist, overwhelmed and fatigued, struggles to conceal an axe after a troubling incident while navigating his way home.
